message.content: This question requires knowledge about the fundamental principles of physics, specifically electrostatics. Objects can repel each other if they have identical charges. This is because like charges repel each other, while opposite charges attract. Option (A) is incorrect because fake magnets would not have any effect on objects. Option (B) is unrelated to the repulsion between objects. Option (D) is unrelated because sunlight does not have the ability to cause objects to repel each other.

When two objects have the same type of charge (either positive or negative), they will exert a repulsive force on each other. Option (A) is incorrect because "fake magnets" is not a scientific concept. Option (B) is unrelated to the principle of repulsion between objects. Option (D) is unrelated to the repulsion between objects, as sunlight does not have an effect on the charges of objects.
